body_html:
I installed python3.6.5 64bit from python.org website on my windows. Following commands works fine without any issues on Windows 7 and Windows 10.

pip3 install --upgrade tensorflow

In addition I also ran following command for installing jupyter notebooks and other useful packages

pip3 install jupyter pandas matplotlib scikit-learn

Most likely the issue might be user has 32 bit python installed on windows. By default when you download python from python.org, you are downloading 32 bit and not 64-bit. Download 64 bit python and try again.

In addition I also ran following command for installing jupyter notebooks and other useful packages

Most likely the issue might be user has 32 bit python installed on windows. By default when you download python from python.org,  you are downloading 32 bit and not 64-bit.   Download 64 bit python and try again.
body:
I installed python3.6.5 64bit from python.org website on my windows. Following commands works fine without any issues on Windows 7 and Windows 10.

`pip3 install --upgrade tensorflow`

In addition I also ran following command for installing jupyter notebooks and other useful packages

`pip3 install jupyter pandas matplotlib scikit-learn`

Most likely the issue might be user has 32 bit python installed on windows. By default when you download python from python.org,  you are downloading 32 bit and not 64-bit.   Download 64 bit python and try again.
